title: TIASA
content:
TIASA was the Naiad-nymph of the stream and springs of the Tiasa near Amyklai (Amyclae) in Lakedaimonia
        (southern Greece). She was a daughter of the local river-god Eurotas.

Pausanias, Description of Greece 3. 18. 6 (trans. Jones) (Greek travelogue C2nd A.D.)
          :
        "As you go down to Amyklai (Amyclae) from Sparta [in Lakedaimonia] you come to a river called Tiasa. They
        hold that Tiasa was a daughter of Eurotas."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
